events.originalText: The ZX81, a pioneering British home computer, was launched by Sinclair Research, and went on to sell more than 1.5 million units around the world.
events.subtitle: ZX81
events.headline: ZX81 Home Computer Launched by Sinclair Research

events.originalText: BOAC Flight 911 disintegrated and crashed near Mount Fuji shortly after departure from Tokyo International Airport, killing all 113 passengers and 11 crew members on board.
events.subtitle: BOAC Flight 911
events.headline: BOAC Flight 911 Crashes Near Mount Fuji, Killing All On Board

events.originalText: American country-music performers Patsy Cline, Cowboy Copas, and Hawkshaw Hawkins were killed when their PA-24 crashed shortly after takeoff in Camden, Tennessee.
events.subtitle: Country music
events.headline: Country-Music Performers Killed in Plane Crash in Tennessee

events.originalText: Cuban photographer Alberto Korda took his iconic photograph Guerrillero Heroico of Marxist revolutionary Che Guevara.
events.subtitle: Alberto Korda
events.headline: Cuban Photographer Takes Iconic Photo of Che Guevara

events.originalText: World War II: The Gloster Meteor, the Allies' only operational jet aircraft, made its maiden flight.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Allies' Gloster Meteor Jet Aircraft Makes Maiden Flight in WWII

events.originalText: Roberto Cofresí, one of the last Caribbean pirates, was apprehended after his flagship sloop Anne was captured by authorities.
events.subtitle: Roberto Cofresí
events.headline: Caribbean Pirate Roberto Cofresí Apprehended by Authorities

events.originalText: Peninsular War: At the Battle of Barrosa, Anglo-Iberian forces trying to lift the Siege of Cádiz defeated a French attack but could not break the siege itself.
events.subtitle: Peninsular War
events.headline: Battle of Barrosa: Anglo-Iberian Forces Defeat French Attack

events.originalText: American Revolution: British soldiers fired into a crowd in Boston, killing five people.
events.subtitle: American Revolution
events.headline: British Soldiers Kill Five in Boston Crowd During American Revolution

events.originalText: King Henry VII of England issued letters patent to John Cabot and his sons, authorising them to explore undiscovered lands.
events.subtitle: Henry VII of England
events.headline: King Henry VII Authorizes John Cabot to Explore Undiscovered Lands

events.originalText: The Livonian branch of the Teutonic Order suffered a great loss when 71 knights died in the Battle of Aizkraukle.
events.subtitle: Livonian Order
events.headline: Teutonic Order Suffers Loss in Battle of Aizkraukle

events.originalText: Roman–Persian Wars: Roman emperor Julian and his army set out from Antioch to attack the Sasanian Empire.
events.subtitle: Roman–Persian Wars
events.headline: Roman Emperor Julian Sets Out to Attack Sasanian Empire in Roman-Persian Wars
